image.altText: a woman giving the finger at a man as he walks away

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Lee made the gesture towards a journalist at a press conference after the ACT Property Council's leaders debate on Wednesday.

title.children: Canberra Liberals leader Elizabeth Lee makes rude gesture at journalist following tense press conference exchange

image.altText: ACT Labor Leader Andrew Barr stands on a stage speaking behind a podium.

props.synopsis: The ACT chief minister says it was a mistake to appoint Walter Sofronoff to head an inquiry into the trial of Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: Barr says Sofronoff's appointment to board of inquiry a 'mistake'

image.altText: A plane with 'Batik' branding begins its take-off from the runway.

props.synopsis: The airline says it will reinstate the Canberra to Denpasar services when market conditions are more conductive.

title.children: Batik Air suspends flights indefinitely between Canberra and Bali four months after they started

image.altText: Shane Drumgold holding a folder walking into ACAT.

props.synopsis: The ACT Bar Council dismisses 10 complaints made about former ACT director of public prosecutions Shane Drumgold during his prosecution of former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann over the alleged rape of Brittany Higgins.

title.children: Complaints about the conduct of former ACT top prosecutor Shane Drumgold during Bruce Lehrmann trial dismissed

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: The court found the man's BMW convertible was "substantially over-insured" for more than $130,000, when he'd purchased it for $25,000 a year before the incident.

title.children: Driver jailed after staging car crash as part of $130,000 insurance fraud attempt

image.altText: A woman in a yellow vest passes a piece of paper to a woman wearing a cream jumper and red skirt.

props.synopsis: Canberrans will head to the polls on Saturday to choose the 11th Legislative Assembly. Here's everything you need to know about where to vote, what time the polls close, how to fill in ballot papers and when we're likely to know results.

title.children: Here's what you need to know about voting in the ACT election

image.altText: A close up image of recycled cardboard

props.synopsis: Plans to build what would be Australia's largest plastics recycling plant in the NSW Southern Highlands have advanced despite community opposition and environmental concerns.

title.children: Residents outraged by proposal to put Australia's largest recycling plant 200 metres from their homes

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Senior Constable Kristian White will face a jury trial in November after he pleaded not guilty over the death of the great-grandmother who was tasered in a Snowy Mountains nursing home in 2023.

title.children: NSW police officer to face jury trial over taser death of 95yo Clare Nowland

image.altText: Andrew Barr wearing a dark grey jacket filling out a form in a polling booth.

props.synopsis: From news, analysis and explainers through to election previews, key electorates and candidates, ACT Votes has the latest on the upcoming state election. Click through to read more.

title.children: ACT Votes 2024 — stay up to date with the latest election news and analysis

image.altText: Jake Stringer holds up two fingers towards the crowd

props.synopsis: Jake Stringer appears set to return to Essendon after the GWS Giants walked away from trade discussions involving the polarising forward. Follow live.

title.children: Jake Stringer left in limbo as Giants withdraw interest hours out from trade deadline

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump dancing at campaign event

props.synopsis: The US presidential candidate wrapped up his event ahead of schedule but remained on stage while nine songs played.

title.children: Donald Trump turns campaign event into impromptu musical session

image.altText: A sign that says 24/7 banking with a Westpac logo next to it.

props.synopsis: Customers with Westpac and St George have experienced difficulties accessing their internet banking for the third day in a row. Treasurer Jim Chalmers says the government has been in contact with the bank.

title.children: 'Really concerning': Treasurer responds to Westpac outages

image.altText: A family photo with four people - Danniel, his two children and his wife Caitland on a white bed smiling.

props.synopsis: A Brisbane inquiry has heard that four defence members killed in a defence helicopter crash were experiencing "hazardous" fatigue levels.

title.children: Brisbane inquiry into fatal army helicopter crash reveals men were flying at 'hazardous' fatigue levels

image.altText: Medibank Private

props.synopsis: New government figures show the number of people with top-level gold health insurance coverage has dropped by more than 400,000 between December 2020 and the end of last year.

title.children: Warnings issued to those downgrading health insurance

image.altText: Two young men smile for the camera on the red carpet for the 2019 Logies.

props.synopsis: Radio host, TV star and podcaster Hamish Blake on his secret fitness training, taking up golf, the 'barbs that stick in your heart' when raising children, and other parenting challenges.

title.children: When Hamish Blake turned 40, he took up this 'farcical' sport as a promise to Andy Lee

image.altText: Young Caucasian man taking a self portrait on a couch wearing a brown cap, a black singlet and an orange scarf.

props.synopsis: Jake Bradford has not been seen since his mother reported him missing more than 600 days ago. Police found what they suspect to be human remains during a search of the tiny Victorian town of Dollar.

title.children: Police uncover remains in search for allegedly murdered 21yo Victorian man

image.altText: Perth Stadium

props.synopsis: Perth will host the first Ashes Test of the 2025/26 season, handing the new Perth Stadium its first-ever men's Ashes Test.

title.children: Perth to host series opener in 43-year first as Ashes dates are locked in

image.altText: Lisa Marie Presley at the Cartier Flagship Store for a special party to unveil the book "Cartier: Untamed".

props.synopsis: Lisa Marie Presley died before she had the chance to finish her memoir, From Here To The Great Unknown. Per her wishes, her eldest daughter Riley Keough helped it make its way into the world.

title.children: Lisa Marie Presley's posthumous memoir is a sad, shocking and tender look at the price paid for fame

image.altText: Ollie Olsen in a 1991 promo shot for his project Third Eye.

props.synopsis: Ian 'Ollie' Olsen, a significant figure in Australia's post-punk scene and a pioneer in experimental electronic music, has died following a lengthy illness.

title.children: Ollie Olsen, influential Australian post-punk and electronic musician, dies aged 66

image.altText: Aerial view of beach, on sunny day with homes and escarpment in the background

props.synopsis: A judge has ruled a man convicted of murdering a child when he was a teenager "freely and voluntarily" interacted with a woman and her toddler at the beach.

title.children: Murderer breached supervision order by approaching woman and child at NSW beach

image.altText: Jess lies on the grass laughing.

props.synopsis: Jess Cerro — aka the singer-songwriter Montaigne — didn't study music in school because the tuition was expensive, but taught themselves guitar and pursued music anyway.

title.children: For years Montaigne assumed their savings were taken care of. Then they realised 'the truth' about their finances

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: Australian shares have finished the day lower after losses on Wall Street, where all three benchmarks fell.  Look back on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX 200 closes lower, key jobs data out tomorrow — as it happened

image.altText: An older woman with short grey hair and rounded glasses smiles.

props.synopsis: The federal government's threat to ban excessive debit card surcharges by 2026 has been welcomed by customers and small businesses who have been hit with higher costs for years — but not everyone is on board.

title.children: 'I was quite shocked': Convenience almost cost one woman $150 in card surcharges

image.altText: man with tower in bakground

props.synopsis: Around 60,000 devices including mobile phones, medical devices and alarms will not work beyond October 28 when Optus and Telstra shut down their 3G networks and the government is urging people to be prepared.

title.children: As the 3G switch off looms, tens of thousands of devices still need updating

image.altText: A close up photo of a man wearing a suit and blue tie.

props.synopsis: The US government warns Israel that if it does not improve access to humanitarian aid in Gaza in the next 30 days, American military funding to the country may be cut.

title.children: White House's $26.7b warning to Israel: Improve aid or we'll cut your military funding

image.altText: Kingsley Dixon sits on a hill of orange brown rubble, in front of a horizon of mined land.

props.synopsis: In the world's only jarrah forests a US aluminium giant has been mining bauxite for 60 years. Scientists say the damage may be permanent.

title.children: The world's only jarrah forests have been mined for 60 years. The damage may be permanent

image.altText: A gloved hand holds a black spherical piece of debris.

props.synopsis: Mysterious black spheres washed up on Coogee Beach on Tuesday. The beach has been closed until further notice as Randwick City Council works to safely remove the debris and investigates.

title.children: Sydney's Coogee Beach shut after discovery of mysterious black balls

image.altText: Albanese in a high-vis yellow vest speaks in front of a microphone in front of a green sign

props.synopsis: Household batteries could form part of a plan to make electricity cheaper for low- to middle-income earners before the next election.

title.children: Household battery scheme to form part of Labor's pre-election plan for low- and middle-income earners

image.altText: A man in a suit stands in front of a woman in a pink jacket, two men in suits and a man in a cammo Navy outfit in front of a

props.synopsis: The Henderson shipyard will house a multi-billion-dollar defence precinct for naval shipbuilding and servicing of AUKUS nuclear-powered submarines, creating an industry the state government claims will rival WA's massive resources sector.

title.children: Thousands of jobs set to be created at new Perth defence shipbuilding and submarine maintenance precinct

image.altText: Close up of woman with brown hair tied back has gold framed glasses, with pale skin and brown eyes. She looks ahead solemnly.

props.synopsis: Tayla-Jane Jackson had a late-term abortion in 2023 with the agreement of two doctors. She does not want a private member's bill introduced by Liberal MLC Ben Hood to pass parliament.

title.children: 'I would not be able to cope': One of the few women in SA who needed a late-term abortion doesn't agree with changing the laws

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie

props.synopsis: Sydney MP Alex Greenwich welcomed news that the Liberal member for North Shore, Felicity Wilson, will cross the floor to vote in favour of the equality bill, but said her party's stance was "worrying".

title.children: Sydney MP worried about 'right-wing trend' as Coalition rejects conscience vote on equality bill

image.altText: A white and blue coloured "Lufthansa" flight takes off with three other jets from the carrier seen on the tarmac below

props.synopsis: Lufthansa agrees to pay the US federal transport agency its largest-ever penalty issued against an airline for civil rights violations.

title.children: German flag carrier Lufthansa to pay record US penalty over mistreatment of 128 Jewish passengers

image.altText: A family photo of two parents and three young children, against the backdrop of a blue beach.

props.synopsis: Jess Meikle, her husband, their five-year-old twins and four-year-old have embarked on an Australian caravanning extravaganza.

title.children: What's the best age for kids when planning a family gap year?

image.altText: Woman stands in bunch holding a bunch of documents

props.synopsis: Darwin woman Toni Grant was shocked when she received a call from a stranger telling her they'd found personal records containing her mobile number, tax file number and medical information in a pile of rubbish in bushland. Similar documents belonging to others were also found.

title.children: Toni's personal information was found dumped in the bush. She's been looking for answers ever since

image.altText: A composite image of Leanne Pompeani, with the iamge on the left showing an Asics logo and the logo removed on the right.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne Marathon Festival has apologised after an image of a winning athlete posted to its Instagram page was apparently edited to obscure the logo of a competitor of its naming-rights sponsor.

title.children: Nike-sponsored Melbourne Marathon apologises after sharing photo of winner with Asics logo edited out
